title: Removing Celestial Body is such a fucking unbelievably stupid decision IT HURTS

embed.description: WIP !] [STATUS: PBE is up! Working!] The PBE has been updated! As we continue the 8.4 PBE cycle, today's patch includes more tentative balance changes! Continue reading for more information! body:
Celestial Body is currently being removed on the PBE in favor of an absolutely dogshit talent that merely gives 20% additional Elixir uptime, which is in fact a perk set of Inspiration right now. This is not actually being owed to Celestial Body being overpowered but being seen as garbage and underused.

http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=banjayceforme

I need to go into Sorcery as Singed for Celerity, but heavily lean toward the use of Future's Market. To compensate for the fact that I have no resistances, I use Celestial Body for 100+ HP and an additional 60+ from Doran's Ring to get by the early laning phase. This is absolutely necessary in a game that promotes ranged top and damage if you opt out of Resolve.

I REALLY DON'T SEE THE LOGIC IN WHY IT IS BEING REMOVED.

replies.body:
So Riot's solution for a rune that almost nobody uses............is to replace it with a rune that even LESS people are going to use?

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

I think the reason nobody used Celestial Body is because they saw the -10% damage and immediately noped out. That really hurts your ability to trade, and the additional 100 hp looks bad on paper. 

Increasing potion duration is a good way to give players another defensive-minded rune that doesn't have a downside, which automatically makes it more attractive. I'm alright with at least seeing where this goes.
I'll take 100 HP over 7-8 less damage on my AAs any day

Sure, I'm not saying that Celestial Body was a bad idea. I'm just saying that the fact that it had a downside at all is what caused people to ignore it. And fighting human nature is a losing battle in game design.
That last bit needs to be on a t-shirt

celestial body was already fantastic on support champs  or lanes with hard match ups (melee verse ranged).
No reason why it should be removed.  People will learn its usefulness.

It absolutely wasn't fantastic on supports. Most supports desperately need their damage for the laning phase. It's fine if it falls off afterwards, but less damage means less trading potential, and that's a killer early on. You don't need 100 extra health; you do need the ability to threaten to kill your opponent. It only makes sense on someone who already carries very low kill pressure and has relatively low alternative rune synergy, but the only one who really meets that criteria is Braum. Even he's usually better off going for either approach velocity or just skipping the tree entirely and taking future market.
20% Potion Time and 5% Movement Speed is something people would use.

it appears to me the intention is to force junglers to get {{item:2031}} {{item:2032}} and the new rune, given the reduced lifesteal on jungle item as well; sustain is going to be harder for junglers overall, and junglers r gonna have to make trade-offs between farming and ganking. Even just by looking at the new jungle item which thrives on counter jungling, i think it's pretty evident that riot wants junglers to be punished for ganking too much.
New jungle item will not go live - Meddler confirmed it to be something that was not even tested much (or at all?) internally, so...
even if it doesnt go live, just the fact that riot tried to implement it supports my argument--- riot wants junglers to make meaningful trade-offs between farming and ganking

We know some players are really attached to Celestial Body, and we know there are feel bads around removing any rune. :c That being said, the logic to remove it is this: 

- Inspiration is not intended to be the first choice Path for defenses or resistances.
- We are putting in some new/other defensive runes in Resolve (Bone Plating, etc.) which overlap a lot of the same gameplay space as Celestial Body. 
- Tonic is not intended to be a direct replacement for Body even though we're adding that and removing Body at the same time. 

EDIT: PS Sorry for being late to seeing this topic.

> Inspiration is not intended to be the first choice Path for defenses or resistances.

What is it intended to do then ? And please dont tell me its supposed to be quirky and fun....
Its supposed to have creative tools and rule bending, so isnt one of rule bending part that this path has defensive and ofensive choices ? It also has perfect timing which i could argue is the best defensive minor in the game.

>We are putting in some new/other defensive runes in Resolve (Bone Plating, etc.) which overlaps a lot of the same gameplay space as Celestial Body. 

And everyone is giving you feedback about how that rune is going to break the game and make it even less about laning phase. It will only help weak early game tanks be even more obnoxious and will put on top strong early tanks as unmovable walls.

>Tonic is not intended to fill the same niche as Body even though we're adding that and removing Body at the same time.

Why ? 

Honestly it all feels like you guys at riot always thought of inspiration as the "fun" runes that were maybe to be used for fun in normals from time to time and you didnt pay much attention to them and when they started to be most picked ones whole balance team panicked.

I will also use this post to exclaim how sad i am that a lot of champions are forced to pick aery just because i dont see them have any other good offensive choice.

We've always thought of Inspiration as a competitive Path, for sure. But Inspiration is intended to be about "twisty" power - power that is indirect (Futures Market) or applied correctly situationally (Perfect Timing or Hexflash). 

Open to discussion about which runes fall in line with that identity or fall short in your opinion, but the evaluation from us was that +100 health was a pretty direct and broadly applicable defensive tool that would probably be better suited to somewhere like Resolve in the future.
Honestly, stopwatch is far more offensive of an item (and rune) in regular and pro-play than Celestial Body and taken on virtually everyone. Shouldn't that be a balancing priority?
Why not opt to change Celestial Body to the Resolve path instead -Under a new name of course- rather than remove it completely? Was it just not a healthy rune?

I feel like free item rune fall short in the situationally part. If the item provided is too good, everyone must take it while if the item is not cost effeicient you sabotage yourself by taking the rune.

They are to binary to me (the item is worth taking or not) and unlike future market where you can do a lot of different stuff with it, the decision making involving those are pretty low
